Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SyCPA 63 (thurinsyn; XXD; XXL, lipopeptide; chemically synthetic AMPs20; lactam; XXJ; UCSB1a)
Sequence Information.Source: bioinformatic predicted bacterial nonribosomal gene cluster,Bacillus thuringiensisplasmid BMB171, bacteria-derived, natural derivatives
Sequence Information.Target Organism: active against B. subtilis 168 1A1 (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. faecium Com15 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. aureus USA300 (MIC 8 ug/ml), E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 16 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 10031 (MIC 8 ug/ml), A. baumannii ATCC 17978 (MIC 32 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa PAO1 (MI 16 ug/ml), E. cloacae ATCC 14037 (MIC 64 ug/ml), M. tuberculosis H37RV (MIC 6 ug/ml). This peptide shows the broadest activity spectrum in this family of peptides.
Sequence Information.N-terminal Modification: coupled with fatty acid tetradecanoic acid; R2 is a D-amino acid;

Literature.Author: Chu J, Koirala B, Forelli N, Vila-Farres X, Ternei MA, Ali T, Colosimo DA, Brady SF. 2020
Literature.Title: Synthetic-Bioinformatic Natural Product Antibiotics with Diverse Modes of Action.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: the peptide was predicted but made in a different way.
